span.span: Congratulations to our Valedictorian and Salutatorian for the Class of 2020! Your accomplishments are an inspiration to us all.

div.a: Regents Examination and Graduation Requirements Questions Related to COVID-19 Closure

span.text-node: Regents and Graduation Requirements Cheat Sheet
and FAQ Dcoument will help guide you through the new graduation requirements due to the cancellation of

div.span: Regents Exams. School counselors and teachers will be addressing the individual situations with parents and students within two weeks.
The "Students" tab above now has additional resources for remote learning.
This page will continue to be updated as teachers expand resources.
If your child is utilizing a school device and connecting to the Internet via cellular data (a hot spot), data charges may apply. Please contact your carrier to confirm your data plan.

p.span: Pre-K applications have been mailed to families with eligible PK students in the Afton Central School district. If you have a child that is residing in the district who turns 4 on or before December 1, 2020 and you have not received an application, please either print one and return to the Elementary Office (via e-mail to Mr. Graves at

, or fax to 607-639-8257, or mail to Afton Central School, PO Box 5, Afton, NY 13730) or contact Mr. Graves at 607-639-8234 or by e-mail. Applications and pertinent documents are due by Friday, May 29.

img.title: Kristy Garlitz holding a bag of groceries from the food pantry
img.alt: Kristy Garlitz holding a bag of groceries from the food pantry

span.span: is here to serve our community in this uncertain time.

Our school takes pride in providing free breakfast and lunch for our students on a daily basis. We understand the importance of student nutrition and our food service team has created a plan to continue this service during our mandated school closure.

Annual Meeting and Budget Vote - New York State Governor’s Executive Order 202.13.

p.span: NOTICE is hereby given that the
typically held each year on the third Tuesday in
May is hereby postponed until at least June 1, 2020 pursuant to the New York State Governor’s Executive Order 202.13.

span.span: Any Afton Central School Board meeting held during the COVID-19 emergency will be held in accordance with the rules stated in the Executive Order issued by Governor Andrew Cuomo numbered 202.1 found here: https://www.governor.ny.gov/sites/governor.ny.gov/files/atoms/files/EO_202_1.pdf
